alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 21 at 11:52PM MDT until June 22 at 2:30AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern El Paso County in east central Colorado... * Until 230 AM MDT. * At 1152 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain have moved east of the Fountain and Security Areas. However, heavy rainfall continues to fall across southeast El Paso County. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Southern Colorado Springs, Fountain, Hanover, Security-Widefield, Security, Fort Carson, Stratmoor and Truckton. Several roads in Fountain are flooding and water rescues have been reported. This includes the following streams and drainages... Jimmy Camp Creek, Williams Creek, Little Fountain Creek, Turkey Creek, Sand Creek, Cheyenne Creek, Chico Creek, Fountain Creek, Black Squirrel Creek, Pond Creek, Rock Creek, Red Creek, East Fork Red Creek, Little Turkey Creek, South Cheyenne Creek and Burnt Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
